questions.text: A 60-year-old man comes to an emergency with a history of chest pain, which is acute onset. The ECG shows ST depression and T waves inversion. Cardiac biomarkers in the blood are not elevated. What will be the appropriate management?

A victim is found unconscious at the roadside. As a trained rescuer, after checking the victim's response and pulse, you decide on resuscitation. What is the recommended ratio of chest compression to ventilation during CPR?
Which one of the following is not a differential diagnosis of ST-segment elevation in ECG?
Which one of the following is a non-shockable rhythm with respect to the use of AED (Automatic External Defibrillator)?

A 50-year-old man reports to Emergency with breathlessness, palpitations, and acute chest pain. On auscultation, there is a systolic murmur at the apex and ECG shows ST elevations in anterior chest leads. Which one of the following would be the next choice of investigation?

Which of the following electro-cardio-graphic findings are manifestations of digitalis intoxication? 1. Ventricular bigeminy 2. Ventricular tachycardia 3. Atrial flutter 4. Atrial tachycardia with variable block Select the correct answer using the code given below :
According to the modified WHO classification of Heart Disease in Pregnancy, which cardiac lesion is a contraindication for pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Uncomplicated, small or mild pulmonary stenosis

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presents in the Emergency with sudden onset palpitations. His heart rate is 150/minute and gets reverted after a carotid massage. The most probable diagnosis is :
Which one of the following statements is correct regarding Opening Snap in cardiac auscultation?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a high-pitched diastolic sound.

options.label: B
options.text: It is due to the opening of the stenosed aortic valve.

options.label: D
options.text: It precedes the aortic component of the second heart sound.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a high-pitched diastolic sound.

questions.text: A 35-year-old laborer worker consulted a local medical practitioner for recurrent attacks of chest pain. His elder brother had a similar complaint and died at the age of 40 years. The laborer worker was advised to take sublingual nitroglycerin at the time of chest pain. But after taking nitroglycerin, the chest pain increased in intensity. Which one of the following is most likely?

options.label: B
options.text: Chronic type A dissection of the aorta

options.label: D
options.text: Sub-acute bacterial endocarditis involving aortic valve

questions.text: A patient with atrial fibrillation on regular treatment presents with photosensitivity, skin discoloration, and peripheral neuropathy. Which drug may be implicated?

Which of the following are categorized under obstructive lung disease? 1. Bronchial asthma 2. Bronchiectasis 3. Bronchiolitis 4, Pulmonary sarcoidosis Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Risk factors for the development of COPD include which of the following? 1. Tobacco smoking 2. Recurrent infection 3. Coal dust exposure 4. High socio-economic status Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following is not an aim of asthma therapy?
questions.correct_answer: C. Minimal use of inhaled corticosteroid

questions.text: A 65-year-old male smoker has been diagnosed with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD). On pulmonary function testing, the FEV1/FVC < 0.7 and FEV1 = 42% of predicted. The severity of airflow obstruction in this patient as per GOLD criteria are:
A 40-year-old patient with bronchial asthma presents with acute severe breathlessness. Indications for giving him assisted ventilation for acute severe asthma include which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: PaO2 < 80 mm of Hg, PaCO2 < 45 mm of Hg

options.label: B
options.text: PaO2 > 60 mm of Hg, PaCO2 > 45 mm of Hg

options.label: C
options.text: PaO2 < 60 mm of Hg, PaCO2 > 45 mm of Hg

options.label: D
options.text: PaO2 < 80 mm of Hg, PaCO2 > 45 mm of Hg

questions.correct_answer: C. PaO2 < 60 mm of Hg, PaCO2 > 45 mm of Hg

questions.text: Which of the following are the non-metastatic extra-pulmonary manifestations of lung cancer? 1. Carcinoid syndrome 2. Nephrotic syndrome 3. Horner's syndrome 4. Lambert-Eaton syndrome Select the correct answer using the code given below :

A 60-year-old obese person (weighing 110 kg) has been complaining of excessive sleepiness in the daytime, morning headache, irritability, and mood disturbances. The patient also has a history of dry mouth, nocturnal heartburn, and diaphoresis of the chest and neck. Which one of the following will be the best investigation to diagnose the patient?
Which of the following drugs trigger bronchial asthma? 1. Sulfonamides 2. Aspirin 3. ACE inhibitors 4. Beta-blockers Select the correct answer using the code given below :

A patient with Crohn’s disease underwent ileal resection. Which of the following complications may develop in this patient? 1. Oxalate rich renal calculi 2. Diarrhea 3. Fat malabsorption 4. Hypernatremia Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Protein-losing enteropathy due to obstruction of intestinal lymphatic vessels is seen in which of the following conditions? 1. Intestinal lymphangiectasia 2. Constrictive pericarditis 3. Eosinophilic gastroenteritis 4. Whipple's disease Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following viruses is associated with the development of Acute Liver Failure and high mortality in pregnancy?

Consider the following statements with regard to "Anorexia of Aging" : 1. Declining chemosensory function (smell and taste) 2. Reduced efficiency of chewing 3. Slowed gastric emptying 4. Alterations in the neuro-endocrine axis Which of the above statements are associated with early satiety and weight loss in the elderly?

Consider the following statements: 1. Type-1 HRS (Hepato-Renal Syndrome) is characterized by a rapid deterioration in renal function, within 1-2 weeks of presentation. 2. Type-2 HRS is characterized by a moderate and stable or slowly progressive renal dysfunction. 3. HRS is seen in patients with large ascites in case of cirrhosis. Which of the above statements is/are correct?
Which one of the following is the serological marker of immunization with Hepatitis B vaccine?
Infection with which of the following organisms can cause a syndrome that is clinically indistinguishable from achalasia of the esophagus?

Consider the following statements in respect of Helicobacter Pylori: 1. It is a gram-positive, spiral-shaped bacterium. 2. It uses an adhesion molecule (BabA) to bind to the 'Lewis b' antigen on gastric epithelial cells. 3. It produces a 'urease' enzyme that helps to raise the pH around the bacterium. 4. It exclusively colonizes only 'gastric-type' epithelium. Which of the above statements is correct?
The quadruple therapy regime (or OBMT regime) for Helicobacter Pylori eradication comprises which of the following drugs?
questions.correct_answer: A. Omeprazole, Bismuth subcitrate, Metronidazole, Tetracycline

questions.text: Cystic fibrosis disorder is :

Which of the following diseases may be associated with Coeliac disease? 1. Type-2 Diabetes mellitus 2. IgA deficiency 3. Down syndrome 4. Turner's syndrome Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Consider the following statements regarding Coeliac disease: 1. There is a strong association of the disease with Human Leukocyte Antigen, HLA-DQ2/DQ8. 2. There is gluten intolerance found in wheat, rye, barley, and oats. 3. In the elderly, the disease presents with symptoms ranging from florid malabsorption, weight loss, and anemia to oral ulceration, dyspepsia, and bloating. 4. In suspected patients, small bowel biopsy is contraindicated. Which of the above statements is correct?
Asymptomatic bacteriuria is defined as the presence of more than :

options.label: A
options.text: 10 6 organisms/mL in the urine of apparently healthy asymptomatic patients

options.label: B
options.text: 10 4 organisms/mL in the urine of apparently healthy asymptomatic patients.

options.label: C
options.text: 10 3 organisms/mL in the urine of apparently healthy asymptomatic patients.

options.label: D
options.text: 10 2 organisms/mL in the urine of apparently healthy asymptomatic patients.

questions.correct_answer: A. 10 6 organisms/mL in the urine of apparently healthy asymptomatic patients

questions.text: A renal transplant offers the best chance of long-term survival in ESRD and is cost-effective. Which one of the following is not a contraindication to renal transplantation?
questions.correct_answer: B. Children less than one year

questions.text: Which of the following are the mechanisms for anemia in Chronic Kidney Disease? 1. Deficiency of erythropoietin 2. Folate and Vitamin B12 deficiency 3. Toxic effects of uremia on bone marrow 4. Reduced utilization of dietary iron Select the correct answer using the code given below :
The leading cause of Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) globally is :
The presence of Beevor's sign on neurological examination is characteristic of a spinal cord lesion at which one of the following levels?
Which one of the following statements is correct regarding the lower motor neuron type of lesion?
questions.correct_answer: D. Plantar reflex shows flexor response.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the single strongest risk factor for dementia?
Massive retinal hemorrhage with 'blood and thunder' appearance and vision loss is caused by which of the following?
Visual hallucination is characteristic of which type of dementia?

A 37-year-old mother of two children has a bilateral headache that worsens with emotional stress; pain is less severe in the early part of the day but becomes more severe in the evening; there is tenderness over the skull vault. Both children are not doing well in school. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following are the causes of polyneuropathy? 1. HIV 2. Alcohol 3. Phenytoin 4. Rifampicin Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Consider the following statements regarding Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH): 1. It accounts for 35% of all strokes. 2. Most common site of hypertensive ICH is the cerebral cortex. 3. Use of cocaine and methamphetamine is a frequent cause of stroke at a young age. 4. Hypertensive ICH usually results from the spontaneous rupture of a small penetrating artery deep in the brain. Which of the above statements is correct?
A 21-year-old young lady presents with unilateral facial weakness. She is unable to close her eye on the affected side and there are vesicles in her ear. She is suffering from

Which of the following are the clinical features of Neurofibromatosis-1 ? 1. Angiomas 2. Axillary freckles 3. Cutaneous schwannomas 4. Neurofibromas Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which of the following are clinical features of Parkinson's disease ? 1. Bradykinesia 2. Rigidity 3. Spastic gait 4. Mask-like face Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following statements is correct for an individual with blood group AB?

options.label: A
options.text: A antigen on RBC; Anti-B antibody in plasma.

options.label: B
options.text: A and B antigens on RBC; no antibody in plasma.

options.label: C
options.text: B antigen on RBC; Anti-A antibody in plasma.

options.label: D
options.text: No antigen on RBC; Anti-A and Anti-B antibodies in plasma.

questions.correct_answer: B. A and B antigens on RBC; no antibody in plasma.

questions.text: Which one of the following is unlikely to be associated with eosinophilia ?

Which of the following statements regarding G6PD enzyme deficiency are correct? 1. It is an X-linked deficiency. 2. Geographical distribution parallels the malaria belt. 3. Consumption of fava beans is protective. 4. Transfusion support may be life saving. Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Which of the following investigations indicates active hemolysis? 1. Increased reticulocyte count 2. Increased conjugated bilirubin 3. Increased urinary urobilinogen 4. Decreased haptoglobin Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which type of anemia can be caused by the drug Dapsone?
Which of the following are decreased during pregnancy? 1. Iron stores 2. Vitamin B12 levels 3. Folate levels 4. Coagulation factors Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following drugs causes direct X-a inhibition?

A 20-year-old young girl presents with heavy menstrual bleeding, petechiae on her arms, and blood blisters in her mouth. Her complete blood count shows hemoglobin of 7 gm/dL, total leucocyte counts of 8,700 cells/uL, and platelet count of 6,000/uL with a peripheral smear showing large platelets. Which is likely the best initial drug treatment for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: B. High dose glucocorticoids with IVIgG

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presents with malaise, breathlessness off and on, and paresthesias. She is vegetarian by diet. Her investigation revealed Hb-62 gm/dL, MCV-128 fL, and platelet count - 1,20,000/cumm, with a blood smear showing macrocytosis and neutrophil hypersegmentation. What is the likely diagnosis?

Which one of the following conditions may result in hypoglycemia?
Use of which of the following drugs may result in osteoporosis ? 1. Phenytoin 2. Lithium 3. Methotrexate 4. Azathioprine Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following oral anti-diabetic drugs acts on renal proximal tubules?
Which of the following are short-acting insulin? 1. Aspart 2. Lispro 3. Glargine 4. Regular Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Hirsutism is seen in which of the following ? 1. Polycystic ovarian syndrome 2. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia 3. Hypothyroidism 4. Ovarian tumor Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Which of the following is correct regarding hypothyroidism ? 1. It is more common in females. 2. Autoimmunity is a rare aetiopathogenesis. 3. In pregnancy, an increased dose of levothyroxine is required. 4. Suppressed TSH is a risk factor for osteoporosis. Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Which of the following is correct regarding Diabetes insipidus ? 1. Polyuria and polydipsia are common symptoms. 2. Urine is of low osmolality and specific gravity. 3. Lithium is useful in treatment. 4. It is potentially lethal if the hypothalamic thirst center is damaged. Select the correct answer using the code given below :

A 42-year-old lady presents with symptoms of tiredness, constipation, impaired hearing, and weight gain in spite of poor appetite. Which of the following are relevant investigations in this case ? 1. TSH level 2. Free T, levels (unbound T,) 3. Anti-TPO antibodies 4. Radionuclide scan of the thyroid Select the correct answer using the code given below :

A patient presents with circulatory shock, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. A diagnosis of acute adrenal crisis is considered. A blood sample is stored for measurement of serum cortisol and treatment is started without delay. Which of the following are appropriate interventions ? 1. IV normal saline 2. IV hydrocortisone 100 mg stat 3. IV 10% glucose 4. IV KCl as infusion Select the correct answer using the code given below :
The most common acid-base disturbance in critically ill patients is :

Which of the following are the potentially reversible causes of weight gain? 1. Insulinoma 2. Cushing's syndrome 3. Sulfonylureas 4. Beta-blockers Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Which of the following are the metabolic complications of parenteral nutrition ? 1. Hyperglycemia 2. Liver cirrhosis 3. Fluid overload 4. Hyperphosphatemia Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Bartonella infection is an important cause of blood culture-negative endocarditis. Clinical diseases caused by Bartonella species in humans include which of the following? 1. Cat scratch disease 2. Trench fever 3. Carrion's disease 4. Anisakiasis Select the correct answer using the code given below :
The causative organism and the vector for scrub typhus are:
questions.correct_answer: C. Orientia tsutsugamushi and Trombiculid mite

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding tetanus ? 1. Risus sardonicus may be seen. 2. Endotoxin produced has an affinity for sensory nerve endings. 3. Lockjaw is painless. 4. Hysteria can mimic tetanus. Select the correct answer using the code given below :

A 25-year-old traveler from the United Kingdom desires anti-malaria prophylaxis before traveling to India. He has a history of seizures and depression. Which of the following drugs can be used? 1. Doxycycline 2. Atovaquone + Proguanil 3. Chloroquine + Proguanil 4. Mefloquine Select the correct answer using the code given below :
The pulmonary stage is seen in which of the following infections? 1. Ascaris lumbricoides 2. Strongyloides stercoralis 3. Onchocerca volvulus Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Consider the following statements with regard to Amphotericin B: 1. It is a narrow-spectrum antifungal agent. 2. It can cause nephrotoxicity. 3. It lacks oral preparation. 4. Its lipid formulations are less toxic, Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Which one of the following molds causes mucormycosis, commonly known as 'black fungus'?
Which of the following infections are caused by mosquito bites? 1. Malaria 2. Typhus 3. Filariasis 4. Dengue fever Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Recurrent bouts of binge eating are usually associated with :
During the physical assessment of a 55-year-old male with low back pain, the quadriceps (knee) reflex was absent. Which of the following nerve roots is most likely to be affected?

Which of the following conditions are parts of inherited cancer syndrome? 1. Retinoblastoma 2. Li-Fraumeni syndrome 3. Xeroderma pigmentosum 4,. Peutz-Jeghers syndrome Select the correct answer using the code given below :

Which of the following are the diseases associated with DNA repeat sequences ? 1. Huntington's disease 2. Myotonic dystrophy 3. Friedreich's ataxia 4. Klinefelter syndrome Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Cardiac outflow tract defect, thymic hypoplasia, cleft palate, and hypocalcemia are clinical features of which gene disorder?
Early hypotension in venomous snakebite is due to which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Pooling of blood in the pulmonary and splanchnic circulation

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of intravascular volume into the soft tissues

questions.correct_answer: A. Pooling of blood in the pulmonary and splanchnic circulation

questions.text: Gastric aspiration and lavage is contraindicated in which of the following poisonings ? 1. Strong acids 2. Alkalis 3. Petroleum distillates 4. Ethanol Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Acetylcysteine is an antidote for which poisoning ?
Which one of the following is not a constituent of treatment of severe hyperkalemia ?
Kyasanur Forest Disease is endemic to :
Which one of the following is not a usual cause of Type-2 respiratory failure ?

A 10-year-old girl is diagnosed with dengue fever. She has abdominal pain and persistent vomiting. Examination reveals normal blood pressure but the hematocrit is found to be increased. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial fluid management ?
A child presents with headache and vomiting in the emergency room following a fall from the bed. Which one of the following treatment modalities is not recommended in the emergency room ?

options.label: C
options.text: Elevate the head end by 30 degrees

questions.text: The recommended ratio for chest compression to breaths administered by a single rescuer during resuscitation of a child in cardiac arrest is :

A 4 year old comatose chils is assessed by the Modified Glasgow Coma Scale. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the score given as E2V3M2 for the best eye opening response, best verbal response and best motor response respectively ?

options.label: A
options.text: Eye opening to speech, makes incomprehensible sounds and abnormal flexion

options.label: B
options.text: Eye opening to speech, inappropriate words and abnormal flexion

options.label: C
options.text: Eye opening to pain, moans to pain and abnormal flexion

options.label: D
options.text: Eye opening to pain, cries to pain and extension to pain

questions.correct_answer: D. Eye opening to pain, cries to pain and extension to pain

questions.text: What will a baby with mild hypothermia feel like, when touched by the back of the hand of an examiner ?

options.label: A
options.text: The entire body will feel cold.

options.label: B
options.text: The abdomen and feet will be warm, but hands will be cold.

options.label: C
options.text: The abdomen will be warm, but the hands and feet will be cold.

options.label: D
options.text: The abdomen, feet and hands will all feel cold.

questions.correct_answer: C. The abdomen will be warm, but the hands and feet will be cold.

questions.text: Which of the following manifestations is/are seen in hypocalcemia ?
A 6-week-old infant presents with unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia. Which of the following could be a likely diagnosis ?

A mother with polyhydramnios gives birth to a term newborn infant who develops choking and cyanosis on feeding soon after birth. There is excessive drooling and frothing from the mouth. Most likely diagnosis is :
An infant has just started to watch his mother intently when she talks to him. He has not yet started smiling back. What is the approximate age of the child?
A child demonstrates a mature pincer group and can build a tower of a maximum of 6 blocks and can make vertical and circular strokes with the pencil. His developmental age is around :
A typically developing girl can creep upstairs and builds a tower of 2 blocks. Which of the following skills should she also display?

A child can ride a tricycle, hop on one foot but cannot skip. He uses alternate feet while going downstairs. Which one of the following motor skills should he be able to perform at this developmental level?
Which one of the following skills is a normally developing 2-year-old child unable to perform?

options.label: C
options.text: Building a vertical tower of 6 blocks

questions.text: Which one of the following statements is age-appropriate for a normally developing 4-month-old infant?

options.label: A
options.text: The infant can bring his hands to the midline.

options.label: B
options.text: The infant has still not attained partial head control.

options.label: C
options.text: The infant has started to reach out with one hand.

options.label: D
options.text: The infant has started making monosyllable sounds like 'da' or 'pa'.

questions.correct_answer: A. The infant can bring his hands to the midline.

questions.text: Which one of the following is used to estimate the surface area of burn injuries in children less than 15 years of age?

Atomoxetine is prescribed to children with Autism Spectrum Disorder to control symptoms of :

Protective efficacy of Varicella vaccine when used for post-exposure prophylaxis (given within 72 hours of contact) is approximately :
A 10-year-old child presents with difficulty in word recognition, word decoding abilities difficulty in spelling with normal listening comprehension. The most likely diagnosis is :

Which one of the following is the correct, schedule for home visits by an Accredited Social Health Activist for facility-born newborn babies?
questions.correct_answer: C. On3, 7, 14, 21, 28 and 42 days of life
